overall_perception_summary.headline: The Clinical Pragmatist
overall_perception_summary.description: Aquaphor feels like the emergency room in a tube. It completely bypasses the beauty and lifestyle categories to position itself as a medical utility for crisis management. It plays the role of the ultimate reliable authority—sterile, serious, and singularly focused on biological repair rather than aesthetic improvement.

foundation.title: Medical Authority
foundation.description: The brand is a Healer, deriving authority exclusively from the Clinical Lab and Dermatologist validation. It operates on a Safety First value system, sacrificing sensory elegance (greasy, odorless) for absolute tolerance. The strategy is purely Medical Authority—a utilitarian tool for fixing pathologies.

identity.title: The Sterile Caregiver
identity.description: There is a significant professional distance here; the brand acts as a Specialist doctor, not a friend. Dominated by The Caregiver (60%) and The Sage (30%), it uses Pharma-Code visuals to signal safety. The voice is a Clinical Authority—dry, grave, and aggressively factual.

communication.title: Problem-Solving Science
communication.description: The messaging is that of a Problem Solver, hooking the user with specific ailments (Cracked, Dry, Irritated) rather than dreams. The USP is The Specialist—owning the 'semi-occlusive' mechanism that allows skin to breathe while healing. The narrative is a Lab Breakthrough, focused entirely on the mechanism of action.

benefits.title: Biological Relief
benefits.description: Functionally, it is a Fixer, aiming for deep tissue Restoration rather than surface beauty. The Emotional payoff is Relief—the cessation of pain or discomfort. Socially, it is The Safe Choice, offering the comfort of the herd and the assurance that 'this is what the doctors use.'

marker_1.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)
marker_1.reasoning: The authority is entirely clinical—'Clinically proven,' 'Dermatologist Recommended,' and 'Advanced Therapy' anchor the brand in the medical establishment (Authority: 1/5 Pure Clinical). The goal is to fix broken skin, not enhance it—'Restore smooth, healthy skin,' 'Repairing Ointment,' and 'Heal' signal a mission to cure pathology rather than beautify (Mission: 1/5 Pathology Cure). Clinical source + fixing focus = The Healer.
marker_1.evidence: Clinically proven to restore smooth, healthy skin... #1 Dermatologist Recommended Brand... Repairing Ointment... For dry, cracked, or irritated skin

marker_2.reasoning: The scope is hyper-focused on specific skin failures—'cracked hands,' 'cuticles,' 'dry feet,' 'minor burns' (Scope: 1/5 Micro-Correction). However, the access is universal—'Find a Retailer' points to mass-market giants like Walmart and Walgreens, positioning this as a democratic staple for every medicine cabinet (Access: 5/5 Democratic). Specific fix + mass access = The Democratizers.
marker_2.evidence: Dry, cracked skin... chapped lips... cracked cuticles... dry feet and heels... Find a Retailer

marker_3.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Spec Sheet (Exact percentages, pH, sourcing)
marker_3.reasoning: The brand relentlessly prioritizes safety and tolerance over cosmetic elegance or aggressive actives. 'Preservative and fragrance free,' 'Hypoallergenic,' and 'Skin protectant' appear before any aesthetic claims (Performance: 1/5 Hypoallergenic). Transparency is high on the 'Spec Sheet' level, explicitly calling out '41% Petrolatum' as the active percentage (Transparency: 1/5 The Spec Sheet). Absolute safety + technical specs = Safety First.
marker_3.evidence: Preservative and fragrance free... Hypoallergenic... 41% Petrolatum... Skin Protectant... Non-comedogenic

marker_4.reasoning: The visual vibe is stark—white background, dark blue text, no lifestyle models, no 'vibes.' It looks like it belongs on a pharmacy shelf, not a vanity (Aesthetic: 1/5 Clinical Sterile). The value proposition is that of a utility staple—a 'multi-purpose' tool for the whole family that you buy on autopilot (Value: 2/5 Daily Essential). Sterile look + utility value = The Medical Authority.
marker_4.evidence: One essential solution... multi-purpose uses... dark blue and white packaging... simple tube design

marker_5.reasoning: The personality is devoid of warmth. There are no exclamation points, no slang, and no emotional adjectives. It delivers facts: 'Clinically proven,' 'Formulated with.' (Thermostat: 1/5 Robotic). It speaks from a position of absolute authority—'#1 Dermatologist Recommended'—leaving no room for peer-to-peer connection (Power Dynamic: 5/5 The Deity). Cold + Authoritative = The Reliable Expert.
marker_5.evidence: Clinically proven... Uniquely formulated... #1 Dermatologist Recommended Brand... Skin protectant

marker_6.reasoning: The primary drive is protection and healing—'Healing Ointment,' 'Protectant,' 'Baby' usage scenarios position it firmly as The Caregiver (60%). The reliance on 'Clinically proven' and 'Dermatologist' brings in The Sage (30%) as the method of care. The claim of being '#1' adds a touch of The Ruler (10%). Dominant Caregiver (Group A) = The Stabilizers, offering certainty and protection in a chaotic world of skin irritation.
marker_6.evidence: Healing Ointment... Skin Protectant... Clinically proven... #1 Dermatologist Recommended... restores smooth, healthy skin

marker_7.reasoning: Warmth Score = 1.5 (Low). Energy Score = 1.5 (Low). This is the voice of a prescription pad. There is absolutely no humor, the formality is strict ('Uniquely formulated'), and the enthusiasm is non-existent. It uses medical terminology ('semi-occlusive,' 'Petrolatum') to maintain a distance that builds trust through sterility.
marker_7.evidence: Uniquely formulated with 41% Petrolatum... allow oxygen to flow... help heal the skin... minor cuts and burns

marker_8.reasoning: The visual palette is classic medical: stark white background, deep navy blue (authority), and clinical teal/cyan accents. There is no warmth, no texture, and no lifestyle 'chaos.' The layout is a rigid grid of information. This is Pharma-Code, designed to look like it belongs in a hospital.
marker_8.evidence: Dark blue band... White tube... Red 'Healing' text... Cyan accents... Simple sans-serif typography... Droplet icon
marker_8.look_and_feel: Sterile, trustworthy, and utilitarian; the visual equivalent of a white lab coat.
marker_8.primary_palette: Clinical white dominated by authoritative navy blue with urgent red accents.

marker_9.reasoning: The messaging leads with the result—'Healing,' 'Repairing,' 'Restores.' It targets the solution to a problem (Hook: 4/5 Result). The persuasion is entirely rational, relying on 'Clinically proven' claims and specific ingredient percentages ('41% Petrolatum') to argue the case (Persuasion: 1/5 Raw Data). Result-focused + Data-backed = The Problem Solver.
marker_9.evidence: Healing Ointment... Clinically proven to restore... 41% Petrolatum... allow oxygen to flow

marker_10.reasoning: There is no founder story. The heroes are the faceless 'Dermatologists' who recommend it and the scientists who 'Uniquely formulated' it (Protagonist: 1/5 The Nobel). The setting is implied to be a sterile lab or clinic, focused on 'oxygen flow' and 'skin barriers' rather than a garden or kitchen (Setting: 1/5 Sterile). Science-led + Lab-set = The Lab Breakthrough.
marker_10.evidence: #1 Dermatologist Recommended... Uniquely formulated... oxygen to flow... semi-occlusive barrier

marker_11.reasoning: The primary validator is the 'Board'—specifically the claim of being the '#1 Dermatologist Recommended Brand' (Validator: 1/5 The Board). The proof offered is technical and mechanism-based: 'semi-occlusive barrier,' 'oxygen flow,' '41% Petrolatum.' This is 'Graph' territory, even if the graph is described in words (Proof: 1/5 The Graph).
marker_11.evidence: #1 Dermatologist Recommended Brand... semi-occlusive barrier... allow oxygen to flow... 41% Petrolatum

marker_12.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP OBJECT (What You Claim to Own)
marker_12.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Tech (How it works: Encapsulation, Time-Release)
marker_12.slider_b_label: [SLIDER] THE TARGET SCOPE (How Wide Is The Net?)
marker_12.reasoning: While they list Petrolatum, the real USP is the *mechanism*: the 'semi-occlusive' barrier that allows oxygen to flow while keeping moisture in. They claim to have engineered a better way to seal skin (Ownership: 4/5 Tech). The scope is problem-focused—dry, cracked, irritated skin—rather than a general 'moisturizer' for everyone (Scope: 4/5 The Problem).
marker_12.evidence: Uniquely formulated... allow oxygen to flow... semi-occlusive barrier... create an ideal healing environment

marker_13.reasoning: The content explains the 'how'—how the ointment works with oxygen and petrolatum (Depth: 2/5 Explainer). The intent is to build trust through this explanation and the dermatologist endorsement, rather than to close a quick sale or inspire with lifestyle imagery (Intent: 1/5 The Thesis). Explainer + Trust = Science Education.
marker_13.evidence: How it works... allow oxygen to flow... help heal the skin... different from a lotion

marker_14.reasoning: This is The Fixer. It targets 'cracked,' 'irritated,' and 'broken' skin. It is not maintenance; it is intervention (Action: 5/5 The Fixer). The outcome is Biological health—restoring the skin barrier and function, not just making it look pretty or glowy (Outcome: 1/5 Biological). Fixer + Biology = Restoration.
marker_14.evidence: Repairing Ointment... Cracked hands... Cuticles... Minor burns... Restore smooth, healthy skin

marker_15.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Panic Mode (Urgent need to stop pain/itch)
marker_15.reasoning: The emotional driver is the removal of a negative. It targets the 'Panic Mode' of having cracked, bleeding, or painful skin (Anxiety: 1/5 Panic Mode). The payoff is simply feeling 'Comfort'—returning to a normal baseline where your skin doesn't hurt (Self-Perception: 2/5 Comfort). Urgent relief + return to normal = Relief / Safety.

marker_16.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Tool (I buy it only because it functions)
marker_16.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Standard (What everyone uses; the default)
marker_16.reasoning: You don't buy Aquaphor to show off; you buy it because it is a Tool that works. It is purely functional (Signal: 1/5 The Tool). It is 'The Standard'—the default choice for tattoos, babies, and dry lips. Owning it signals nothing but pragmatism (Tribal: 1/5 The Standard). Tool + Standard = The Pragmatist.
marker_16.evidence: Multi-purpose... essential solution... One essential solution for many skincare needs

marker_17.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Normalization (I want to look like everyone else)
marker_17.reasoning: The social goal is Normalization—healing your skin so you look like everyone else again (Social Vector: 1/5 Normalization). The group is The Majority—this is a mass-market product used by millions. Buying it puts you in the safest, largest tribe possible (Group Dynamic: 1/5 The Majority). Normalization + Majority = The Safe Choice.
marker_17.evidence: #1 Dermatologist Recommended... Essential for every home... Multi-purpose
